DOCNAME: CASE OF NAMLI AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG , ORG and ORG requested the annulment of the record in the title deed registry of the applicants’ father ’s and other ORG ( hereinafter “ the defendants ” ) ownership of CARDINAL plots of land ( nos . CARDINAL , DATE , DATE and DATE ) situated in the village of GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE ORG gave a decision on the merits of the case . Each of these decisions was in turn quashed by ORG .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings several defendants including Mr ORG ORG , who was the husband of the second applicant and the father of the remaining applicants , died . Shortly thereafter , in DATE , the applicants became parties to the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to annul the record in the title deed registry except for a part of plot no . DATE which remained under the name of the defendants .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of the first - instance court .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ request for rectification of its decision . This decision was not served on the applicants . However , it was sent to the registry of ORG on DATE .
